form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Lummis (for herself, Mr. Risch, Mr. Crapo, Mr. Daines, Mr. Sheehy, and Mr. Barrasso) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to clarify that a permit is not required under the National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System for a discharge resulting from the aerial application of certain products used for fire control and suppression, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Forest Protection and Wildland Firefighter Safety Act of 2025.
Section 402(l)(3) of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act (33 U.S.C. 1342(l)(3)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking this section for a discharge from and inserting the following:
in clause (i) (as so designated), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: a discharge resulting from the aerial application of a product used for fire control and suppression purposes that appears on the most current applicable Qualified Products List maintained by the Forest Service (or any successor list).

subparagraph.text: by striking (C) The authorization and inserting the following:
by striking Section 505(a) and inserting section 505(a);
by striking 402(p)(6) and inserting subsection (p)(6); and
by striking 402(l)(3)(A) each place it appears and inserting subparagraph (A).
